metadata.title: USN-4966-2 -- libx11 vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-4966-1 fixed a vulnerability in libx11. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM and Ubuntu 16.04 ESM.  Original advisory details:   It was discovered that libx11 incorrectly validated certain parameter  lengths. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to trick libx11  into emitting extra X protocol requests.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4966-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libx11-6 - 2:1.6.2-1ubuntu2.1+esm2 libx11-data - 2:1.6.2-1ubuntu2.1+esm2 libx11-xcb-dev - 2:1.6.2-1ubuntu2.1+esm2 libx11-xcb1 - 2:1.6.2-1ubuntu2.1+esm2 libx11-doc - 2:1.6.2-1ubuntu2.1+esm2 libx11-6-udeb - 2:1.6.2-1ubuntu2.1+esm2 libx11-dev - 2:1.6.2-1ubuntu2.1+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
